revised_title: Exploring Anomalies in Vision: A Study of Nyctalopia and Its Implications
tldr: This article presents two cases of vision anomalies, one of nyctalopia (night blindness) and the other of double vision due to optic nerve issues. The author, William Briggs, discusses the possible causes and treatments for these conditions, including the use of spectacles, medications, and other therapies. The cases provide valuable insights into the understanding of vision disorders and their impact on daily life.
